reviews.review_msg: Dr Somers went off topic so often in lectures. He would do this so often it felt like he just enjoyed the sound of his own voice. I didn't like his teaching style as I felt he often would just read off of slides, and I disagreed with his political views about substance use. Avoid if possible.
Dr. Somers is an awesome prof ��

He makes the course seem simple, interesting, relevant, and an easy A but when you get your final grade back you will be surprised at how terrible you actually did. He gives 0 feedback throughout the semester but just keep telling you that you did great (even though clearly you didn't based off your final grade). Lots of reading.

I don't write too many on RMP, but I am severely concerned about Nicole's rating. Nicole's lectures were very insightful and the marking was clear and fair.

I would take Nicole's course 100% again.

Do not get fooled by the rating. Almost everyone in the class was satisfied with the course.

she doesnt know how to teach seminar classes. very inexperienced and provides little to no feedback on assignments. refused to give feedback on presentations or participation, grading is unfair and borderline arbitrary. nice as a person though
shes the nicest person but very inexperienced prof and not fit to teach a 4th year seminar. avoid at all cost

It was quite difficult to get a good grade in this class as it was graded by few things and Dr. Catherine was an extremely tough grader. She provides thorough feedback but even if you follow all of her suggestions and adjust your assignments accordingly, your grade will barely change (might even go down). Also did not any post grades on Canvas

I was honestly expecting to receive a much higher grade for a seminar class in this size. I think there were only 18 people in the class but only one person received an A- to my knowledge (which is the average grade for seminar classes). Very hard marker, very vague feedback and does not provide any of the presentation grades

she's a nice person but man, she did NOT know how to teach AT ALL. VERY unclear about how students are being graded and the little feedback provided on assignments was unhelpful and very vague. do not recommend.

One of the best profs. Kind, passionate, knowledgeable, and truly wants you to engage in class. Tight marking, but provided the most clear and valuable feedback I've ever had on my research papers. Pushes you out of comfort zone with public speaking and no references, but provides more than enough notice to prepare. Highly recommend! :)

she's a mediocre prof. very unclear about instructions and criteria for assignments and gives poor feedback. expects way too much for an undergrad course. she's nice tho, just not very helpful. content is repetitive throughout the semester and gets pretty boring.

Dr. Catherine is truly an amazing professor. I would recommend anyone who plans to do research in the future to take her class. While she does grade assignments difficultly, she rewards improvement and really teaches you how to write effectively. Overall one of the most useful classes I have taken in my undergrad.
